title: Aram Khachaturian
summary: Aram Ilyich Khachaturian (/ˈærəm ˌkɑːtʃəˈtʊəriən/;[1] Russian: Арам Ильич Хачатурян, IPA: [ɐˈram ɨˈlʲjitɕ xətɕɪtʊˈrʲan] (listen); Armenian: Արամ Խաչատրյան, Aram Xačʿatryan;[upper-alpha 1] 6 June [O.S. 24 May] 1903 – 1 May 1978) was a Soviet and Armenian composer and conductor. He is considered one of the leading Soviet composers.[5][6][7]
